title: Equation Solver – Solve Linear, Quadratic & Systems of Equations

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Solving a linear equation: Start from: ax + b = c Subtract b from both sides: ax = c - b Divide by a: x = (c - b) / a

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Quadratic formula: Given ax^2 + bx + c = 0, define the discriminant D = b^2 - 4ac. If D > 0, there are two distinct real roots. If D = 0, there is one repeated real root. If D < 0, the roots are complex conjugates. The roots are: x = (-b ± √D) / (2a)

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: x_{n+1} = x_n - f(x_n) / f'(x_n) The derivative f'(x) is approximated numerically, and the process continues until the change between iterations is smaller than the specified tolerance or the maximum number of iterations is reached.
